step.cmd: To configure the sitemap provider, click/tap its pencil icon in the first column of the table.

strow.stentry: If checked, the Sitemap module settings override the page prioritization rules of the provider. If unchecked, allows the provider to specify how the pages would be prioritized.
The order in which the providers would be used, if more than one provider is enabled.

step.cmd: Configure the settings for general DNN pages.

strow.stentry: If checked, the priority for each page is computed based on its hierarchy level. Top level pages are assigned a priority of 1.0, and lower levels are 0.1 less than the next higher level (i.e., the second level pages are assigned a priority of 0.9; the third level, 0.8).

If Use page level based priorities? is checked, the lowest priority used. Example: If minimum priority is set to 0.7, all pages on the fourth level, as well as pages on all lower levels, will be assigned a priority of 0.7.
If checked, pages that are not visible in the menu are also included in the sitemap.

step.cmd: Configure the settings for the sitemap.

stentry.uicontrol: Exclude URLs With a Priority Lower Than

strow.stentry: The minimum priority to include in the sitemap.

The number of days before the sitemap is regenerated. If set to Disable Caching, the sitemap is regenerated whenever requested. If you have a large site (i.e., at least 50,000 URLs), cache the sitemap for at least one day to help improve your site's performance.
Click/Tap to delete all cached sitemaps. A new sitemap is generated at the next request.
